alert.note: Alert for Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 18 at 8:03AM EST until February 18 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation and heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 11 inches, sleet accumulations of one half to three quarters of an inch and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Aroostook County. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Friday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Power outages are possible.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet and ice will make travel extremely dangerous. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
